page.title: 02Peterlee and Peter Lee.
page.content: {Peter Lee}was a man who decided that the miners' life needed improving. His first job was at{Littletown Colliery working as a pony driver, ten hours a day at the age of ten. He had worked in 15 collieries by the age of 21.When at{Wingate,}he made his mind up to educate himself by going to classes at night.He became a representative at the Miners' Council in Durham at age 23. He was a Rural district Councillor and a County Councillor.He died on 16th. July 1935 and is buried at {Wheatley Hill.}In 1946{"Farewell {Squalor"}was printed. It was a plan made for the council by{C.W.Clarke,}an engineer and surveyor, for a new town in this area. The town was named {Peterlee,}because he was a man who wanted to raise the miner's standed of living, which was what the town was meant to do with better homes.
